summary.long: Hosea is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came unto Hosea, the son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beginning of the word of the Lord by Hosea. And the Lord said to Hosea, Go, take unto thee a wife of whoredoms and children of whoredoms: for the land hath committed great whoredom, departing from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim; which conceived, and bare him a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto him, Call his name Jezreel; for yet a little while, and I will avenge the blood of Jezreel upon the house of Jehu, and will cause to cease the kingdom of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass at that day, that I will break the bow of Israel in the valley of Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived again, and bare a daughter. And God said unto him, Call her name Lo-ruhamah: for I will no more have mercy upon the house of Israel; but I will utterly take them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will have mercy upon the house of Judah, and will save them by the Lord their God, and will not save them by bow, nor by sword, nor by battle, by horses, nor by horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when she had weaned Lo-ruhamah, she conceived, and bare a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said God, Call his name Lo-ammi: for ye are not my people, and I will not be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the number of the children of Israel shall be as the sand of the sea, which cannot be measured nor numbered; and it shall come to pass, that in the place where it was said unto them, Ye are not my people, there it shall be said unto them, Ye are the sons of the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the children of Judah and the children of Israel be gathered together, and appoint themselves one head, and they shall come up out of the land: for great shall be the day of Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say ye unto your brethren, Ammi; and to your sisters, Ruhamah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
lest I strip her naked,
and set her as in the day that she was born,
and make her as a wilderness,
and set her like a dry land,
and slay her with thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will not have mercy upon her children;
for they be the children of whoredoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their mother hath played the harlot:
she that conceived them hath done shamefully:
for she said, I will go after my lovers,
that give me my bread and my water,
my wool and my flax, mine oil and my drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, behold, I will hedge up thy way with thorns,
and make a wall, that she shall not find her paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For she did not know that I gave her corn, and wine, and oil,
and multiplied her silver and gold, which they prepared for Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore will I return,
and take away my corn in the time thereof,
and my wine in the season thereof,
and will recover my wool and my flax
given to cover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now will I discover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers,
and none shall deliver her out of mine hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also cause all her mirth to cease,
her feast days, her new moons,
and her sabbaths, and all her solemn feasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will destroy her vines and her fig trees,
whereof she hath said, These are my rewards
that my lovers have given me:
and I will make them a forest,
and the beasts of the field shall eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will visit upon her the days of Baalim,
wherein she burned incense to them,
and she decked herself with her earrings and her jewels,
and she went after her lovers,
and forgat me, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, behold, I will allure her,
and bring her into the wilderness,
and speak comfortably unto her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will give her her vineyards from thence,
and the valley of Achor for a door of hope:
and she shall sing there, as in the days of her youth,
and as in the day when she came up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I will take away the names of Baalim out of her mouth,
and they shall no more be remembered by their name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in that day will I make a covenant for them
with the beasts of the field, and with the fowls of heaven,
and with the creeping things of the ground:
and I will break the bow and the sword
and the battle out of the earth,
and will make them to lie down safely.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness:
and thou shalt know the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and the earth shall hear the corn, and the wine, and the oil;
and they shall hear Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then said the Lord unto me, Go yet, love a woman beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress, according to the love of the Lord toward the children of Israel, who look to other gods, and love flagons of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought her to me for fifteen pieces of silver, and for an homer of barley, and an half homer of barley:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I said unto her, Thou shalt abide for me many days; thou shalt not play the harlot, and thou shalt not be for another man: so will I also be for thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the children of Israel shall abide many days without a king, and without a prince, and without a sacrifice, and without an image, and without an ephod, and without teraphim:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: afterward shall the children of Israel return, and seek the Lord their God, and David their king; and shall fear the Lord and his goodness in the latter days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the word of the Lord, ye children of Israel:
for the Lord hath a controversy with the inhabitants of the land,
because there is no truth, nor mercy,
nor knowledge of God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By swearing, and lying, and killing,
and stealing, and committing adultery,
they break out, and blood toucheth blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore shall the land mourn,
and every one that dwelleth therein shall languish,
with the beasts of the field,
and with the fowls of heaven;
yea, the fishes of the sea also shall be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet let no man strive, nor reprove another:
for thy people are as they that strive with the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore shalt thou fall in the day,
and the prophet also shall fall with thee in the night,
and I will destroy thy mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge:
because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee,
that thou shalt be no priest to me:
seeing thou hast forgotten the law of thy God,
I will also forget thy children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As they were increased, so they sinned against me:
therefore will I change their glory into shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They eat up the sin of my people,
and they set their heart on their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And there shall be, like people, like priest:
and I will punish them for their ways,
and reward them their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they shall eat, and not have enough:
they shall commit whoredom, and shall not increase:
because they have left off to take heed to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people ask counsel at their stocks,
and their staff declareth unto them:
for the spirit of whoredoms hath caused them to err,
and they have gone a whoring from under their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sacrifice upon the tops of the mountains,
and burn incense upon the hills,
under oaks and poplars and elms,
because the shadow thereof is good:
therefore your daughters shall commit whoredom,
and your spouses shall commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not punish your daughters when they commit whoredom,
nor your spouses when they commit adultery:
for themselves are separated with whores,
and they sacrifice with harlots:
therefore the people that doth not understand shall fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though thou, Israel, play the harlot,
yet let not Judah offend;
and come not ye unto Gilgal,
neither go ye up to Beth-aven,
nor swear, The Lord liveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Israel slideth back as a backsliding heifer:
now the Lord will feed them as a lamb in a large place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephraim is joined to idols: let him alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their drink is sour:
they have committed whoredom continually:
her rulers with shame do love, Give ye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wind hath bound her up in her wings,
and they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And the revolters are profound to make slaughter,
though I have been a rebuker of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know Ephraim,
and Israel is not hid from me:
for now, O Ephraim, thou committest whoredom,
and Israel is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Blow ye the cornet in Gibeah,
and the trumpet in Ramah:
cry aloud at Beth-aven, after thee, O Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke:
among the tribes of Israel have I made known that which shall surely be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The princes of Judah were like them that remove the bound:
therefore I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is oppressed and broken in judgment,
because he willingly walked after the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore will I be unto Ephraim as a moth,
and to the house of Judah as rottenness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Ephraim saw his sickness,
and Judah saw his wound,
then went Ephraim to the Assyrian,
and sent to king Jareb:
yet could he not heal you,
nor cure you of your wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will be unto Ephraim as a lion,
and as a young lion to the house of Judah:
I, even I, will tear and go away;
I will take away, and none shall rescue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will go and return to my place,
till they acknowledge their offence, and seek my face:
in their affliction they will seek me early.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
After two days will he revive us:
in the third day he will raise us up,
and we shall live in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then shall we know, if we follow on to know the Lord:
his going forth is prepared as the morning;
and he shall come unto us as the rain,
as the latter and former rain unto the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee?
O Judah, what shall I do unto thee?
for your goodness is as a morning cloud,
and as the early dew it goeth away.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice;
and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they like men have transgressed the covenant:
there have they dealt treacherously against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity,
and is polluted with blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And as troops of robbers wait for a man,
so the company of priests murder in the way by consent:
for they commit lewdness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel:
there is the whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also, O Judah, he hath set an harvest for thee,
when I returned the captivity of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I would have healed Israel,
then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered,
and the wickedness of Samaria:
for they commit falsehood;
and the thief cometh in,
and the troop of robbers spoileth without.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they consider not in their hearts
that I remember all their wickedness:
now their own doings have beset them about;
they are before my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They make the king glad with their wickedness,
and the princes with their lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker,
who ceaseth from raising after he hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the day of our king the princes have made him sick with bottles of wine;
he stretched out his hand with scorners.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among the people;
Ephraim is a cake not turned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strangers have devoured his strength,
and he knoweth it not:
yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him,
yet he knoweth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face:
and they do not return to the Lord their God,
nor seek him for all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart:
they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Woe unto them! for they have fled from me:
destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me:
though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they have not cried unto me with their heart,
when they howled upon their beds:
they assemble themselves for corn and wine,
and they rebel against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I have bound and strengthened their arms,
yet do they imagine mischief against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return, but not to the most High:
they are like a deceitful bow:
their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue:
this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set the trumpet to thy mouth.
He shall come as an eagle against the house of the Lord,
because they have transgressed my covenant,
and trespassed against my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel shall cry unto me, My God, we know thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel hath cast off the thing that is good:
the enemy shall pursue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have set up kings, but not by me:
they have made princes, and I knew it not:
of their silver and their gold have they made them idols,
that they may be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For from Israel was it also:
the workman made it; therefore it is not God:
but the calf of Samaria shall be broken in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they have sown the wind,
and they shall reap the whirlwind:
it hath no stalk:
the bud shall yield no meal:
if so be it yield,
the strangers shall swallow it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel is swallowed up:
now shall they be among the Gentiles as a vessel wherein is no pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they are gone up to Assyria,
a wild ass alone by himself:
Ephraim hath hired lovers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, though they have hired among the nations,
now will I gather them,
and they shall sorrow a little
for the burden of the king of princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because Ephraim hath made many altars to sin,
altars shall be unto him to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have written to him the great things of my law,
but they were counted as a strange thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For Israel hath forgotten his Maker, and buildeth temples;
and Judah hath multiplied fenced cities:
but I will send a fire upon his cities,
and it shall devour the palaces thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The floor and the winepress shall not feed them,
and the new wine shall fail in her.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They shall not offer wine offerings to the Lord,
neither shall they be pleasing unto him:
their sacrifices shall be unto them as the bread of mourners;
all that eat thereof shall be polluted:
for their bread for their soul shall not come into the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will ye do in the solemn day,
and in the day of the feast of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For, lo, they are gone because of destruction:
Egypt shall gather them up,
Memphis shall bury them:
the pleasant places for their silver, nettles shall possess them:
thorns shall be in their tabernacles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The days of visitation are come,
the days of recompence are come;
Israel shall know it:
the prophet is a fool,
the spiritual man is mad,
for the multitude of thine iniquity,
and the great hatred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The watchman of Ephraim was with my God:
but the prophet is a snare of a fowler in all his ways,
and hatred in the house of his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah:
therefore he will remember their iniquity,
he will visit their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Though they bring up their children, yet will I bereave them,
that there shall not be a man left:
yea, woe also to them when I depart from them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim, as I saw Tyrus, is planted in a pleasant place:
but Ephraim shall bring forth his children to the murderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give them, O Lord: what wilt thou give?
give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All their wickedness is in Gilgal:
for there I hated them:
for the wickedness of their doings
I will drive them out of mine house,
I will love them no more:
all their princes are revolters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is smitten,
their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit:
yea, though they bring forth,
yet will I slay even the beloved fruit of their womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God will cast them away,
because they did not hearken unto him:
and they shall be wanderers among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel is an empty vine,
he bringeth forth fruit unto himself:
according to the multitude of his fruit
he hath increased the altars;
according to the goodness of his land
they have made goodly images.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart is divided;
now shall they be found faulty:
he shall break down their altars,
he shall spoil their images.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have spoken words,
swearing falsely in making a covenant:
thus judgment springeth up as hemlock in the furrows of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The inhabitants of Samaria shall fear
because of the calves of Beth-aven:
for the people thereof shall mourn over it,
and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it,
for the glory thereof, because it is departed from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall be also carried unto Assyria for a present to king Jareb:
Ephraim shall receive shame,
and Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Samaria, her king is cut off as the foam upon the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, thou hast sinned from the days of Gibeah:
there they stood:
the battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity did not overtake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ye have plowed wickedness,
ye have reaped iniquity;
ye have eaten the fruit of lies:
because thou didst trust in thy way,
in the multitude of thy mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore shall a tumult arise among thy people,
and all thy fortresses shall be spoiled,
as Shalman spoiled Beth-arbel in the day of battle:
the mother was dashed in pieces upon her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So shall Beth-el do unto you
because of your great wickedness:
in a morning shall the king of Israel utterly be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Israel was a child, then I loved him,
and called my son out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As they called them, so they went from them:
they sacrificed unto Baalim,
and burned incense to graven images.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I drew them with cords of a man,
with bands of love:
and I was to them as they that take off the yoke on their jaws,
and I laid meat unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall not return into the land of Egypt,
but the Assyrian shall be his king,
because they refused to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the sword shall abide on his cities,
and shall consume his branches, and devour them,
because of their own counsels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And my people are bent to backsliding from me:
though they called them to the most High,
none at all would exalt him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How shall I give thee up, Ephraim?
how shall I deliver thee, Israel?
how shall I make thee as Admah?
how shall I set thee as Zeboim?
mine heart is turned within me,
my repentings are kindled together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not execute the fierceness of mine anger,
I will not return to destroy Ephraim:
for I am God, and not man;
the Holy One in the midst of thee:
and I will not enter into the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall walk after the Lord:
he shall roar like a lion:
when he shall roar,
then the children shall tremble from the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall tremble as a bird out of Egypt,
and as a dove out of the land of Assyria:
and I will place them in their houses, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim compasseth me about with lies,
and the house of Israel with deceit:
but Judah yet ruleth with God,
and is faithful with the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim feedeth on wind,
and followeth after the east wind:
he daily increaseth lies and desolation;
and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians,
and oil is carried into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He took his brother by the heel in the womb,
and by his strength he had power with God:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: even the Lord God of hosts; the Lord is his memorial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore turn thou to thy God:
keep mercy and judgment,
and wait on thy God continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is a merchant,
the balances of deceit are in his hand:
he loveth to oppress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich,
I have found me out substance:
in all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that were sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I that am the Lord thy God from the land of Egypt
will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles,
as in the days of the solemn feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have also spoken by the prophets,
and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes,
by the ministry of the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And Jacob fled into the country of Syria,
and Israel served for a wife,
and for a wife he kept sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And by a prophet the Lord brought Israel out of Egypt,
and by a prophet was he preserved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim provoked him to anger most bitterly:
therefore shall he leave his blood upon him,
and his reproach shall his Lord return unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Ephraim spake trembling, he exalted himself in Israel;
but when he offended in Baal, he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now they sin more and more,
and have made them molten images of their silver,
and idols according to their own understanding,
all of it the work of the craftsmen:
they say of them, Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they shall be as the morning cloud,
and as the early dew that passeth away,
as the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out of the floor,
and as the smoke out of the chimney.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I am the Lord thy God from the land of Egypt,
and thou shalt know no god but me:
for there is no saviour beside me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I did know thee in the wilderness,
in the land of great drought.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will be unto them as a lion:
as a leopard by the way will I observe them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of her whelps,
and will rend the caul of their heart,
and there will I devour them like a lion:
the wild beast shall tear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, thou hast destroyed thyself;
but in me is thine help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be thy king:
where is any other that may save thee in all thy cities?
and thy judges of whom thou saidst,
Give me a king and princes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I gave thee a king in mine anger,
and took him away in my wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up;
his sin is hid.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Though he be fruitful among his brethren,
an east wind shall come,
the wind of the Lord shall come up from the wilderness,
and his spring shall become dry,
and his fountain shall be dried up:
he shall spoil the treasure of all pleasant vessels.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, return unto the Lord thy God;
for thou hast fallen by thine iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take with you words, and turn to the Lord:
say unto him, Take away all iniquity, and receive us graciously:
so will we render the calves of our lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Asshur shall not save us;
we will not ride upon horses:
neither will we say any more to the work of our hands,
Ye are our gods: for in thee the fatherless findeth mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will heal their backsliding,
I will love them freely:
for mine anger is turned away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be as the dew unto Israel:
he shall grow as the lily,
and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His branches shall spread,
and his beauty shall be as the olive tree,
and his smell as Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim shall say, What have I to do any more with idols?
I have heard him, and observed him:
I am like a green fir tree.
From me is thy fruit found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is wise, and he shall understand these things?
prudent, and he shall know them?
for the ways of the Lord are right,
and the just shall walk in them:
but the transgressors shall fall therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator
